title: Calories in an IPA
meta_description: Discover calories in an IPA (12 oz serving), including carbs, protein, alcohol content, and variations for different styles.
assumptions: Standard 12 oz (355 ml) bottle or can of India Pale Ale (IPA), ~6.5% ABV, craft brew style, no added flavors.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ABV, ingredients, and serving size. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 12 oz IPA contains about 220 calories, mostly from carbs and alcohol.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with beer packaging.

tweaks.label: Switch to a light IPA (lower ABV and carbs)
Opt for a double IPA (higher ABV and hops)

faqs.q: How many calories in an IPA beer?
faqs.a: About 220 calories in a standard 12 oz IPA serving.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in an IPA?
faqs.a: Roughly 18 g of carbohydrates per 12 oz, mainly from malt.

faqs.q: Does IPA have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Minimal: ~2 g protein and 0 g fat per serving.

faqs.q: How does ABV affect calories in an IPA?
faqs.a: Higher ABV (e.g., 8%) adds ~50-100 calories due to more alcohol.
Yes, light IPAs range from 100-150 kcal per 12 oz.
